column1: BBC News NI outlines the latest data on coronavirus and vaccinations across Northern Ireland and the Republic of Ireland.There has been one more Covid-19-related death recorded in Northern Ireland in the past 24 hours
column2: with the total number of deaths now 2
column3: 133.Another 119 people have tested positive for coronavirus.There are 69 people in hospitals with Covid-19 - nine of them are in intensive care
column4: of whom five are being ventilated.The total number of confirmed coronavirus cases in Northern Ireland stands at 118
column6: 103 people in Northern Ireland have received one dose of a Covid-19 vaccine
column8: 474 have received two doses.The total number of vaccines administered in Northern Ireland is now 1
column10: 577.Last updated 16 April at 14:30 BSTSource: Department of Health Northern IrelandOn Friday
column11: the Republic of Ireland recorded 11 Covid-19-related deaths
column12: with the total number of deaths from the virus now standing at 4
column13: 831.Three of those deaths were recorded in April
column15: two in February and five occurred in January or earlier. Another 420 people have tested positive with coronavirus.The total number of confirmed Covid-19 cases in the Republic of Ireland now stands at 242
column16: 819.There are 190 people with Covid-19 in hospitals - 53 are currently in intensive care.Last updated 16 April at 18:00 local time.As of 14 April
column18: 526 people have received one dose of a Covid-19 vaccine
column20: 477 people have received two doses.The total number of vaccines administered in the Republic of Ireland is 1
column22: 003.Last updated 16 April at 18:00 local time.Source: Department of Health Ireland
